title.narrative: Increase rice Market position & Strengthen internal capital formation

description.narrative:
CHAURU is a young active primary cooperative specialized in irrigation. Because most farmers grow rice on the irrigated fields CHAURU may easily be mistaken to be rice cooperative. Established in 2003 out of a government Irrigation Scheme CHAURU provides several services to farmers. CHAURU has about 860 members depending on the water provided to grow their crops.

CHAURU is an irrigation cooperative. This means the core business is about irrigation about maintaining the channels and pumps about having enough water to grow crops. Their member commitment is also derived from being an irrigation cooperative. There is a necessity for famers to work together within CHAURU because if they don’t do so nobody is getting any water to grow crops.

Collaboration with Agriterra  aim to increase the knowledge on how rise internal capital and also working on their vision of marketing and processing the rice from its members.

CHAURU is primary cooperative established June 2003 in Chalinze district Coast Region is the rural primary co operative society dealing with rice farming through irrigation.

2020: 3 advisory services planned market aggregation sustainable services and market support staff 4 training to attend BFM youth procurement issues and FACT and also 1 exchange visit
CHAURU's goal is to improve the internal capital and positing in market of their processed rice.
